Posts.Content: kat4pink wrote: I am having trouble finding someone else that is either having TAC, or just beginning to, or just RECENTLY had TAC... Lots of women having the AC then the T... I would love to find someone else as I am suppose to start my treatment next Thursday and would like to know what to expect getting all 3 at the same time.. I found a thread that was started a couple of years ago, but so much has changed since then, I would like some more recent info. Thanks!! :-) ~Kathie Dx 12/8/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 1/19 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Is anyone else out there having TAC treatment? kat4pink NatsFan

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2009 04:38PM kat4pink wrote: Thank you so much for responding Tamara...I was starting to think i was by myself around here and was second guessing what my onco was doing... although I trust him, I thought there would be more people having the same treatment. I hope I do as well as you did!

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2009 11:29AM kat4pink wrote: Thanks for all the replies.. I appreciate each one of them! ZUFFA-I have to ask a few curiosity questions..When you say the Taxotere be given over 90 minutes.. does that mean it takes them 90 minutes for it to be injected, or am I not getting it? (which wouldn't surprise me!) Also, why? Since all of this seemed to work well for you, I may ask them to do the same, but would like to have more of a back up then my friend from the internet told me to! lol Also, why warm up the Neulasta shot? Haven't heard that before.. but since you go good results, just wondering how you came up with that? TAMARA- Thanks, I will ask him next time I see him. NANCY -  I had my MUGA yesterday, so should know something soon.. both the heart problems and the leukemia sound pretty scary.. I know they are rare side effects, but still serious ones...Hopefully one day, God PLEASE, they will have a treatment that will only affect the cancer and leave the rest of the body alone!! Thanks again everyone!
Posts.Title: Is anyone else out there having TAC treatment? kat4pink NatsFan

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2009 04:05PM kat4pink wrote: Thanks for responding Nancy, No, he hasn't discussed any long term se's... I am sure I will meet with him one more time before the chemo starts the end of the this week.. Are there others I should be aware about so I can ask him when I see him??
